questions.question: John would not stay in his seat. He had ants in his pants.

choices.answer: restless and can't sit still
sleepy and hungry
itchy and needs a bath
scared and nervous

questions.question: The teacher was tired of all the talking. She was at the end of her rope.

choices.answer: The teacher was clinging to a rope.
The teacher was swinging on a rope in class.
The teacher was out of patience.
The teacher walks on a tightrope in the circus.

questions.question: The baby is the apple of his mama's eye.

choices.answer: The baby hit his mother in the eye with a toy apple.
the baby is very dear to the mother.
the baby cries all night long.
The baby will only eat applesauce.

questions.question: The boy accused his sister of stealing. She told him that he was barking up the wrong tree.

choices.answer: The boy barked all around the house  until midnight.
The sister barked all around the house.
The boy was accusing the wrong person.
The boy and his sister had a barking contest.

questions.question: Joel scored a  100%  on his spelling test. The teacher said he was batting a thousand.

choices.answer: Joel was doing an excellent job at preparing for his tests.
Joel needs to study more often.
Joel spells a thousand words a night.
Joel should practice spelling instead of batting.

questions.question: Tell Santa what you want for Christmas and stop beating around the bush!

choices.answer: Dancing around the Christmas Tree while playing a drum.
Writing out a new list while waiting in line.
Not getting to the point.
crying and screaming at Santa to bring you a lump of coal.

questions.question: The boy ate six hot dogs. His mother warned, never bite off more than you can chew.

choices.answer: Always bite into uncooked hot dogs.
Eat two hot dogs at a time to prevent sickness.
Never do more than you have the ability to accomplish.
You should only eat five hotdogs.

questions.question: She cried wolf so much, the children did not listen to her stories.

choices.answer: To howl like a wolf.
To call your friends wolves.
To write a wolf a letter.
To lie or spread untruths.

questions.question: Johnathan never studied, so when he had to face the music, he was scared.

choices.answer: Turn toward the radio and dance.
To admit that his grade would suffer.
To draw music notes on his test.
To tell the teacher the radio ate his homework.

questions.question: Shane kept shouting out answers and Mrs. Dempsey told him to hold his horses.

choices.answer: Go to the stable and hold a horse leg.
Be patient and wait your turn.
To scream out louder.
To stop participating altogether.
